This is oil paint, I used a palette knife to paint the whole thing so I could have texture. Some parts like the lava are elevated, you can touch them , 4 feet tall, it feels amazing to create somethin like this
THE BEST OF YOUUU

it symbolizes finding inner peace, the big monster face represents inner struggle and anything can distract the mind or trouble it. The monster it about to take over but, the monk is confronting it, its his inner turmoil, and hes going to overcome it and find inner peace, the light is from the monk is shining on the grass and also on the monsters chin area. I wanted to create some tension by the lava about to fall on the monk, but he is not worried. Basically its about keeping a stable state of mind no even when things aren't looking too good for you, sometimes when I meditate I have that problem. The theme is unstable vs stable. Chaos vs peace.

WRITING.TITLE: Holy Hell, just woke in a full sweat from a night terror
WRITING.TEXT: Waking up in my room, except its not my room in the dream, very scattered lighting, more Windows,.black and white....in the dream my door to the hall way is open, I hear somethin coming towards my room, I get up ,have barely any control, falling into the wall, headbutt door to close it and then hit the floor... I cant open my mouth, paralyzed face, can barely make a sound, blurred vision, tryin to yell for my cousin to get up, head butting the wall hoping someone hears, I fall on the floor, crawl back into bed... Look up towards window...looks like someone is standing over top of me...also blurry vision I tell myself its a shadow ..and it keeps moving ...over me, I try to reach out......I smack it.....I feel my face being smacked over an over by rough hands ...it comes closer....a whisper "photos are deceiving,motherfucker" . I woke up in sweat and in the same place as I was in the dream , same position
the top comment is a joke about the ninja turtle

I realized it when I ran 6 miles and my legs were destroyed for the next few days...I had never been hurt like that. My knees felt worn out and my ankles were dying, took me weeks to gain the heart to run again, happened right when I turned 21. My legs have never been the same again. My knees start Feelin worn out everytime I run too long.
thanks

When I first left India I was about 7 years old... I got to the u.s and everythings a blur, there is one strong memory though. Me and my family went to go see pardes in theatres, it was the first movie I had ever seen in my life, before then I had worked on the farm in punjab, it was all I knew. My favorite song was probably Ye dil deewana. When srk is driving away from his life.

that's sweet... I can get to 18 if i dont GUN it every chance i get...which is really reallly hard. It's like it's made to be floored. When I hit 3000 rpm in 1st gear, a sign comes up tellng me to shift to 4th, it saves a lot of gas, and because of the torque, skipping gears like that isnt a big deal. 6th gear is amazing too, I can be in 6th going 40mph, and the gas meter will have full bars, im guessing the v6 is similar. Compared to my 2000 this has replaced, pretty heavenly, I was getting like 15 hway, I just need to make some money to hook this thing up, have you heard about the ATAK exhaust.. look up the v6 with it on youtube, shakes the ground
haha definitely, A+++

If you go to bodybuilding.com there are catagories and goals sections, find brain and mind health. They have a lot of stuff. I bought this stuff called bodyquick brain quicken, it was said to increase memory upto 30% for a few hours and holy fuck it worked. I took Hindi class last semester and within one week I knew all the alphabets, before the class even knew 5%. I got up to the board and filled them all out, even my teacher was like wtf
That joints wet, both of em.. I was gonna get the v6 but got the 5.0 cs instead. The v6s look really sweet and gas mileage must be beautiful

I thought I would put up what I have til I reshoot them all, and yeah I don't know why its slow sometimes, someone told me flicker would be a better option. they are all working for me, maybe just reload it?
really? this has happened so many times I thought I fixed it-_-

yeah I know what you mean, I'm actually in my third year in college right now. I'm a communication arts major at vcu, most of the people in my major work digitally, i feel like I am one of the few that wants to pursue oil painting. There are only two painting classes being offered in my major so it's a little hard, and I definitely feel behind due to the fact that I have not really looked into the old masters and tried to replicate their styles. I don't know why but it never really occurred to me to do that until recently. It is my winter break and I have been reading, looking up videos, anything I can, on rembrandt, titian,van gogh, jmw turner, and a few others. I know that I need to get out of this comfort zone, without knowing the history, it will be difficult to make it. I just never thought I would end up in art, until my senior year in high school, never cared for the history. I just hope I'm not too late, I have two years left, I'm gonna go all out. And yeah I know what your saying about line quality...so everything doesn't look the same, it can carry the eye, but, treat every inch of your canvas equally important? the one painting class I have taken has taught me to work more on the focal point and care less about the rest. Thank you for taking the time to tell me alll this, and I'll be glad to hear any more advice.
I changed it to something less distracting, thanks
just incase you didn't know, you could double click and see them bigger, some are actuall high quality

I know most of them are blurry, guess i'll have to reshoot all of them with a better camera. And thanks for the recommendations, will do, I do feel that I need to look at the masters more instead of just trying to do my own thing.. thanks for the feedback
